title: Ferguson: teargas, gunfire and arson following grand jury verdict - as it happened | US news | The Guardian
summary: 'profoundly disappointed ' brown family calls for 'positive change '
wilson will not be indicted for the death of michael brown .
grand jury decision to be announced at 8pm cst .
governor to speak at 5.30pm local time .
michael brown killing : grand jury decision to be announced 'later today '

text: this blog has ended .
continuing coverage will continue with matthew weaver over at a new blog page .
below is a summary of events .

the police officer who shot dead an unarmed black 18-year-old in ferguson , missouri , leading to weeks of unrest and reviving a national debate about law enforcement and race in america , will not face state criminal charges .
a grand jury in st louis county declined to indict darren wilson for killing michael brown on 9 august , following an altercation after the officer stopped him and a friend for jaywalking .
the national guard has been ordered into ferguson after violent protests , including arson and shooting .
the request was made by the mayor james knowles .
barack obama has appealed for calm and an acceptance of the verdict .
he said the problems behind such cases could be fixed , but not by throwing bottles or hurting people '' .
michael brown 's family said they were profoundly disappointed '' by the grand jury 's verdict .
in a statement the family urged protesters to remain peaceful .
i 'll be closing this blog shortly , and my colleague matthew weaver in london will take over on a fresh page .
st louis county police department chief jon belmar has addressed media .
st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) `` alot of gunfire .
i 'm disappointed this evening .
what i 've seen tonight is probably worse than the worse night we had in august . ''
- belmar st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) `` we have no loss of life , but i am disappointed the evening turned out this way . ''
- chief belmar belmar said he and chief dodson and others had a heads up yesterday from bob mcculloch .
he said he did n't know the result , but he knew it was coming .
in response to a question belmar said he does n't think it would have made a difference to their preparations .
multiple people inside mokabe 's cafe are reporting tear gas fired at what was a designated safe place . ''
please be aware these are unconfirmed reports but there are a number of them .
shazzarazza ( @ shazza razza ) # ferguson riot police tear gassed safe house .
protestors fleeing into basement to escape gas .
shordeedoowhop ( @ nettaaaaaaaa ) people were trying to leave out of mokabe 's and the police just shot teargas down the back ally !
this is fucking crazy # shaw justice for all !
( @ msdtweeter ) mokabe 's safe place was gassed , saint johns ' church safe place was also gassed .
police are allowing protesters a safe exit to go away .
winger ( @ wingerroc ) update # ferguson police telling mokabe 's they can exit and leave to the left from the safehouse cops are right outside
vivian ho ( @ vivianho ) people are looting starbucks at 8th/broadway in oakland .
windows smashed .
# ferguson

documents.title: national guard ordered to ferguson
text: governor jay nixon has ordered more national guardsmen to the city , after a request from mayor james knowles , multiple outlets are reporting .
meantime , there are more fires burning , including a car dealership below .
trey yingst ( @ treyyingst ) more cars on fire in # ferguson .
more from the grand jury testimony .
kmox st. louis news ( @ kmoxnews ) wilson : `` i usually elect not to carry ( taser ) .
it is not the most comfortable thing '' # ferguson brian ries ( @ moneyries ) `` hands up . ''
rt @ twitterid : darren wilson described michael brown as `` it '' and a `` demon '' to the grand jury
lauren gambino has filed this dispatch from new york .
in new york city , protestors reacting to the decision not to indict darren wilson , reportedly shut down three city bridges and tossed fake blood on the city 's police commissioner william bratton .
the protests anchored at times square , but a large group broke away and marched more than 80 blocks north to harlem .
i followed some hundreds of protestors to the mouth of the triborough bridge .
police attempted to block protestors here but before the officers could set up , a group darted on to the bridge .
reporters on the bridge said the demonstrators shut it down .
police briefly brawled with the protestors waiting at the entrance to the bridge early tuesday morning .
more than 50 officers ran into the crowd of people who did not cross and instead gathered at the entry point .
police used their batons to beat back protestors .
the confrontation lasted only a few seconds but it entirely changed the tone of the otherwise peaceful protest .
i saw at least two men arrested and heard reports that there were more made on the bridge .
as of 1:30am on tuesday morning , police were still working to clear the triborough bridge and to disperse the nearby protest .
times square was still filled with people chanting hands up , do n't shoot '' and saving protest signs .
brian ries ( @ moneyries ) nypd police chief sprayed with fake blood at nyc protest ( @ jeffrae ) lauren gambino ( @ lgamgam ) protests just got violent # ferguson
a few images of ferguson from guardian reporters on the ground , paul lewis and jon swaine .

paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) armoured personnel vehicle , swat officers with assault rifles hanging off side , suddenly appears out of black smoke like an image from iraq jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) cops with gas masks , rifles and helmet cams staging at the mobil # ferguson jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) st charles county regional swat # ferguson
a letter from darren wilson to his supporters has been leaked , according to ksdk news .
wilson had asked that it was kept secret until after the investigation was completed .
in it he thanks them for standing up for him during this stressful time . ''
it continues : all of you are simply amazing , and i do n't know how to thank you all enough .
i wish i could attend meet you , hug you , and personally thank you for all of your continued support , however , due to my and my families safety i am unable to .
please do n't give this letter to any media or post it where they can see it .
relay the message of thanks to all and keep this letter private until the investigation is complete .
i want you all to know that i do get updates on the amount of support .
unfortunately , i do n't get to see all of the comments made through social media , but overall messages are relayed to me .
thank you from the bottom of my heart , and know that i would do the same for any of you .

also please keep my family in blue in your hearts and prayers , they have all made a sacrifice to their own lives in order to work the excessive hours through the heat and rain to ensure that the riots and protests in ferguson were as safe as they could be .
thank you , p.o .
darren wilson
heavy looting '' going on at w florrisant and chambers , and police have been ordered to a nearby station to secure the parking lot .
the guardian 's amanda holpuch has filed a short take from protests in sacramento .
the crowd grew into the night , with the sacramento county sheriffs department blocking off streets as demonstrators walked back and forth across several blocks , up residents as they went on .
the march was trailed by dozens of officers armed with batons and riot helmets .
whose streets ?
our streets . ''
the missouri grand jury 's decision has sent a message to the world that black lives do not matter .
fists up .
the cops still shoot , writes syreeta mcfadden , in an impassioned piece about the feelings surrounding ferguson right now .
a non-indictment is no absolution of guilt , but are you not angry ?
are you not sick of being unsurprised ?
ferguson is indeed a microcosm - of the all the narratives about race and america that we fear and suppress .
still : it is not enough to say that , yes , of course the promise of justice - the promise of america , of democracy - has failed its black citizens , again .
it does n't make the disappointment any less disappointing , nor the rage any less real .
but it does n't make the moment any less mighty either .
we can choose to say something else .
we are choosing to protest .
read her piece in full here .
we want justice and peace , that 's all we want , '' a protester tells jon swaine .
a cnn reporter has been hit by a thrown rock while doing a live cross .
footage below .
the new york grill , fashions r boutique , advance auto parts and titlemax title loans on w florissant are all burning now , guardian reporters have said .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) fires like this raging everywhere on w florissant st right now .
armed cops on patrol but can not contain .
# f
police have ordered media to leave the area .
earlier in the evening a strict no fly zone was established , a decision which was criticised in the first bout of unrest in august as an attempt to reduce media scrutiny .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) police loud speaker tells media `` leave the city of # ferguson immediately '' .
do n't think that will happen .
there are audible gunshots through the live feeds of ferguson , as well as the sounds of distant explosions .
swat officers are arresting people at gunpoint .
a team is also currently going inside a gas station where people are reportedly be looting .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) swat team ordering me away as they arrest people at gunpoint on w florissant # ferguson
the guardian 's reporter , paul lewis has sent in the below image from ferguson , where troopers are guarding the burning remains of a beauty store and metro pcs on w florissant .
edit : previously incorrectly credited troopers guarding the burning remains of beauty store and metro pcs on w florissant lewis/the guardian us
hello , helen davidson here to take you through the next few hours .
the grand jury evidence which has been released comprises more than 5000 pages , but people are pulling out noteworthy excerpts as they come across them .
below are two small sections of interview with the medical examiner , who was called on scene after the shooting of michael brown .
the medical examiner found nine wounds which appeared to be gunshots .
none were in brown 's back .
the medical examiner also found no weapons .
ferguson grand jury testimony excerpt ferguson grand jury testimony excerpt guardian
the guardian has just posted all the grand jury documents published by the st louis county prosecutor 's office .
you can read them all here .
i 'm handing over our live coverage to my colleague helen davidson in australia .
all eyes are on ferguson right now but protests - all seemingly peaceful - are going around the united states .
world news tonight ( @ wntonight ) where are # fergusondecision protests happening right now ?
guardian journalists heidi moore and lauren gambino were present during protests in times square : heidi was present just before the grand jury decision was announced .

she filed this quick report : in union square , hundreds of protesters held signs and gathered chanting black lives matter '' and no justice , no peace '' as police stood in thick , disorganized lines , watchful but loosely organized .
at 9 pm , when the verdict was supposed to be delivered , the crowd fell silent for several minutes , straining to hear .
chanting and music later broke the silence at a violin duo played songs of 60s racial protest .

lauren was out in times square and sent this video : hands up , do n't shoot '' new york police commissioner bill bratton attended the protests and was splattered fake blood : jeff rae ( @ jeffrae ) breaking : # nyc police commissioner bratton splattered with fake blood at # justice4mikebrown protest in washington : julie zauzmer ( @ juliezauzmer ) crowd at the white house is singing `` lift evry voice and sing '' in kansas city : alex brown ( @ brownealex ) local protesters gather in # kc to protest # ferguson ruling @ 41actionnews in seattle : lindsey wasson ( @ lindseywasson ) powerful silence as # seattle # ferguson protesters sit at broadway and pike near # seattlecentral in chicago : alex chachkevitch ( @ chachkevitch ) # chicago ferguson protest march and finally in sacramento , my colleague amanda holpuch filed this short report : cars honked in support of more than twenty protesters standing on a corner near the sacramento county sheriff 's department .
when communities are under attack - what we do ? ''
stand up fight back '' the crowd chanted .
when the decision was announced the group boo-ed and continued protesting .
the group includes jamier sale who went to ferguson in august to participate in the protests .
they basically just legalized murder by the police , further , '' sale said .
st louis county police confirming that officers are reporting heavy automatic gunfire '' in the west florissant area .
st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) officers reporting heavy automatic gunfire in area of w. florissant and canfield .
paul lewis is in the vicinity and sent this tweet about 10 minutes ago : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) i 'm very glad i bought a bullet-proof jacket .
thought it might be over the top .
streets of # ferguson right now as dangerous as some warzones and here is some video : keith rose ( @ kwrose ) fire on # wflor # ferguson .
federal aviation has announced a no-fly zone over ferguson .
according to the notification posted federal aviation administration website the no-fly zone was put in place in order to provide a safe environment for law enforcement activities '' .
matt pearce ( @ mattdpearce ) ferguson no-fly zone back in effect .
i 'm taking a closer look at the legal basis .

matt pearce ( @ mattdpearce ) it 's 91.137 ( a ) ( 1 ) , for hazard areas law enforcement officials were criticised during the last bout of unrest in ferguson for enforcing a no-fly zone when it was reveal it was put in place to censor media reporting .
guardian journalist paul lewis reports hearing those gunshots on west florissant avenue in the vicinity of the ferguson police department .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) reporters ( me included ) taking shelter amid sounds of repeated gun shots on west florissant ave , where four buildings ablaze .
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) i counted more than 30 gun shots .
police line now retreating after another volley of gun fire on west florissant avenue .

# ferguson meanwhile reporters have tweeting purportedly of michael brown 's mother in the protests outside the police department from about an hour ago : micah grimes ( @ micahgrimes ) colleagues have confirmed that this was michael brown 's mother in the middle of the # ferguson police dept .
protest :
reporters on live tv news just reported hearing a further volley of gunfire near the ferguson police department .
this video has just been posted from the area .
these are confirmed reports .
paul hampel ( @ phampel ) rapid fire pistol shots ringing out near this fire
there are multiple reports of looting in ferguson , along with some reports of people stopping others from looting .
targets include the dollar general store and ferguson market & liquor .

jeanie smith ( @ jeaniesmithksdk ) looting at the dollar tree located at 10752 west florissant # ferguson staci d kramer ( @ sdkstl ) check his timeline for more vines rt @ twitterid4swag : # ferguson
st louis county has released evidence reviewed by the grand jury as they considered whether to charge officer darren wilson in the killing of michael brown .
among the evidence is this photo of officer wilson 's injuries '' : cbs news ( @ cbsnews ) just in : newly released photos of officer darren wilson 's injuries , presented to the grand jury
an aerial photograph of a st louis police car on fire is being tweeted by a number of reporters .

the car is burning near the ferguson police department , according to local tv news : kmov ( @ kmov ) picture from @ twitterid live feed @ twitterid : near 400 blk of s. florissant # stlcopd police car set on fire .
# ferguson
paul lewis is now reporting that protestors are looting shops in the vicinity of the ferguson police department .
a series of unidentified bangs have just gone off .
there have been unconfirmed reports of gunshots heard in the area earlier on .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) series of unidentified bangs .
windows being smashed everywhere .
beauty store being looted .
cars speeding every direction .
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) man next to me uses flower pot to smash his way into frame shop .
walks inside .
emerges empty handed .
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) window of umb bank cracks .
dozens run quickly toward it , try and smash their way inside .
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) scene north of # ferguson right now is lawless .
store fronts being intermittently looted .
stolen goods sprawled across the road .
guardian reporter paul lewis is at the protests outside the ferguson police department , where he reports police have just fired tear gas at protestors .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) protesters ( and me ) coughing as tear gas spreads through crowd .

guardian reporter adam gabbatt is also in area and recently observed some of the damage occurring there as well as protestors throwing missiles at police : adam gabbatt ( @ adamgabbatt ) several windows smashed on businesses on south florissant rd .
about 30m from the police hq objects being thrown at police .
police repeating message to disperse
here is a video of the moment st louis county prosecuting attorney bob mcculloch delivered the decision that officer darren wilson will not be charged with any of the five indictments .
darren wilson not indicted for michael brown shooting
missouri governor jay nixon has released a statement to the people of the region pledging to do everything in my power to keep you safe and protect your right to speak '' .

while the 12 men and women on the st. louis county grand jury have concluded their work , the rest of us have much more work to do in order to use the lessons we have learned these past four months to create safer , stronger and more united communitie , '' nixon says .

his statement continues : as we continue to await word on the u.s. justice department 's ongoing investigation , i urge all those voicing their opinions regarding the grand jury 's decision to do so peacefully .
i also urge everyone to continue working to make positive changes that will yield long-term social , economic and spiritual benefits for all our communities .
my commitment to the people of the region and state is this : i will do everything in my power to keep you safe and protect your right to speak .

we must also make a commitment to one another : to trust more and fear less , to hold ourselves to a higher standard of personal responsibility and mutual respect , and to keep working to extend the promise of america to all our citizens .
the american civil liberties union has also issued a statement .

the grand jury 's decision does not negate the fact that michael brown 's tragic death is part of an alarming national trend of officers using excessive force against people of color , often during routine encounters , '' the union says .
their statement continues : in most cases , the officers and police departments are not held accountable .

while many officers carry out their jobs with respect for the communities they serve , we must confront the profound disconnect and disrespect that many communities of color experience with their local law enforcement .
obama also appealed to protesters to heed a call for peace by michael brown 's parents .
the president said : there are americans who agree with [ decision ] .
and there are americans who are deeply disappointed , even angry .
it 's an understandable reaction .
but i join michael 's parents in asking anyone who protests this decision to do so peacefully .
let me repeat michael 's father 's words .
hurting others or destroying property is not the answer .
no matter what the grand jury decides , i do not want my son 's death to be in vain .
i want it to lead to incredible change , positive change , change that makes the st louis region better for everyone . ''
michael brown 's parents have lost more than anyone .
we should be honoring their wishes .

obama continues : we need to recognize that the situation in ferguson speaks to broader challenges that we still face as a nation : a deep distrust exists between law enforcement and communities of color .
the good news is we know that there are things we can do to help .
to help build better relations between communities and law enforcement we know that makes a difference .
it means working to train officials .
fair to everybody .
i emans enlisting the community in what should be everybody 's goal . ''

documents.title: obama : 'we need to accept ' decision
text: president obama begins speaking from the white house .
it 's an outcome that either way was going to be the subject of intense disagreement not only in ferguson but across america , '' he says .
we need to accept that this decision was the grand jury 's to make . ''
there are multiple reports of shots fired in ferguson : brittany .
( @ bdoulaoblongata ) shots fired .
crowd runs .
police run behind car and draw out guns # ferguson gloria lloyd ( @ glorialloyd ) the crowd at # ferguson police department is lit up by police helicopters , and tv cameras .
lots and lots of media .

four gunshots heard so far and other violence : jim dalrymple ii ( @ jimdalrympleii ) rocks being thrown through a restaurant window some people battered a police car : patrick dehahn ( @ patrickdehahn ) from @ twitterid : tried to flip the cop car , could n't get it over , smashing it down now in # ferguson
president barack obama will make a statement shortly on the grand jury decision , the white house has announced .

documents.title: 'profoundly disappointed ' brown family calls for 'positive change '
text: here is a statement released by the family of michael brown : we are profoundly disappointed that the killer of our child will not face the consequence of his actions .
while we understand that many others share our pain , we ask that you channel your frustration in ways that will make a positive change .
we need to work together to fix the system that allowed this to happen .
join with us in our campaign to ensure that every police officer working the streets in this country wears a body camera .
we respectfully ask that you please keep your protests peaceful .
answering violence with violence is not the appropriate reaction .
let 's not just make noise , let 's make a difference .
mcculloch is asked what he would say to michael brown 's family .

as i 've said at the outset , my heart goes out to them , and regardless of the circumstances , they 've lost a youg man , lost a young life , '' he says : but at the same time , everything was presented .

but everything was presented and 12 people made a decision that as tragic as this is , that it was not a crime it does not lessen this tragedy that while there was a justifiable use of force there was a loss of life here .
that 's why i keep urging people to keep this talk going we have to keep that discussion going this is a horrible tragedy , and we do n't want to see any repeats .
thank you .
that 's it for mcculloch .
i think we 've got time for a couple more here , '' mcculloch says .
he 's asked what evidence apart from a charge '' by brown there is that wilson was justified in using deadly force .
he replies : i ca n't say what they saw is highly significant or not .
but they had all the information in most cases , it is not just one bit of evidence that says alright , that 's it , that 's all we need to hear .
it 's every bit of evidence .

around 20 police officers are now standing outside the ferguson police department , each clad in helmets and carrying riot shields , the guardian 's adam gabbatt reports : they emerged soon after the crowd learned of the darren wilson verdict and remain in place .
some of the crowd are now chanting 'shut it down , ' while others stand in silence .
many declined interviews in the aftermath of the decision , others were in tears .
at least two items were thrown from the crowd towards police officers at around 8.35pm .
there seems to have been no violence since then .
the guardian 's paul lewis is also in the crowd .

protesters reacted angrily when the news rippled through a crowd of several hundred gathered outside ferguson police department , '' he reports : many had been pressed around a car broadcasting a live npr feed of mcculloch 's statement from a clayton courtroom .
several stood on the roof , listening intently to the long statement .
but around five minutes in , the crowd was running out of patience .
it was as though the three people on the car roof could tell from mcculloch 's tone of voice what the news would be .
after the prosecutor uttered the words probable cause , '' there were was an eruption of shouts and screams .
minutes later police in full riot gear ran to form a line in front of the police building .
there is a tense standoff now .
a few plastic bottles have been thrown , combined with incendiary shouts from the crowd .
but the protest is mostly rowdy but peaceful .
a loud speaker is playing hip-hop to chants of no justice , no peace '' and this is what democracy looks like '' .
they gave up their lives they put their lives on hold they poured their hearts and souls into this , '' mcculloch says when asked if he regrets calling the grand jury in the first place .
i join with the michael browns family in urging everyone to continue the demonstrations , but to do so in a contructive way , '' mcculloch say as he draws the statement to a close .
he is then asked what the grand jury 's vote count on each charge .
he declines to give details .
jamil smith ( @ jamilsmith ) mcculloch asked whether perjury charges are forthcoming .
replies that he thinks those who offered testimony truly believed their accounts .
all decisions in the criminal justice system must be determined by the physical and scientific evidence anything less is not justice , '' mcculloch says .
meanwhile officer wilson 's legal team have published a statement : joy reid ( @ joyannreid ) statement from darren wilson 's attorneys :
mcculloch is now describing the circumstances under which officer wilson fired at brown .

jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) mcculloch says darren wilson suffered `` some swelling and redness to his face '' lisa brown ( @ lisabrownstl ) mcculloch says brown 's blood and dna were found on outside door of officer wilson 's police vehicle and on officer darren wilson # ferguson jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) new : darren wilson 's gun fired 12 times , says mcculloch .
two shots in car , then 10 more shots , six or seven of which struck mike brown

physical evidence does not look away as events unfold , '' mcculloch says , referring to his earlier observations that some witnesses changed their stories and some based their accounts on rumours circulating in the neighbourhood .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) mcculloch says `` several witnesses '' said they saw michael brown `` punching '' wilson at the officer 's suv

mcculloch is now running through a detailed timeline of the events on 9 august when brown was killed : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) mcculloch says wilson did realise brown was the grocery store robbery suspect moments after first stopping him for jaywalking jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) mcculloch says brown stopped fleeing at canfield dr and coppercreek , turned around and moved back towards wilson .
wilson then shot him

documents.title: wilson will not be indicted for the death of michael brown
text: wilson will not be indicted for the death of michael brown , mcculloch says .
the grand jury has returned no probable cause on any of the five counts .
mcculloch says a number of witnesses who had initially stated that brown had been shot in the back subsequently changed their testimony .
some also conceded they had not seen the shooting but repeated rumours circulating in the neighbourhood .
mcculloch says that the biggest hurdle the grand jury has had to overcome is the coverage of 24 hour news channels and speculation on social media .
mcculloch begins by acknowledging michael brown 's family mourning , a loss that knows no bounds , '' he says .
he then goes offers a brief timeline of events before the grand jury began its hearings .
st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch has arrived to address the press at a courtroom in the clayton justice center .
he will now deliver the decision of the grand jury .
people in ferguson are waiting to hear the grand jury 's decision .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) hundreds gathered round listening to npr 's all things considered broadcast from a car .
these three on roof .
# fergsuon
the press have been given a two minute warning before bob mcculloch speaks .
the guardian 's jon swaine is in the courtroom where the st louis county prosecutor is expected shortly to announce the grand jury 's decision .
the prosecutor 's office says testimony will be released online in about an hour .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) new : spokesman for st louis prosecutor says `` most of the grand jury testimony '' on ferguson to be released to press online at 9pm cst
people in times square await the decision will dizard ( @ willdizard ) times square , america and the world wait for the # ferguson decision .
# michaelbrown # darrenwilson and in chicago minku ( @ minkumedia ) hundreds out in bitter cold as # chi2ferguson demo gets underway .
# ferguson # mikebrown and in los angeles and elsewhere across the country .
st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch is due to deliver the grand jury 's decision in around 10 minutes .
my colleague jon swaine is at the clayton courtroom where mccullogh will address the press .
he reports mccullogh will read a 20 minute statement to deliver the decision .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) spokesman says st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch will make a statement on grand jury decision of about 20 mins then take questions
the guardian 's paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) is amongst protestors at the ferguson police department , which appears to be where the largest gathering of protestors has amassed .
paul reports roughly 300 protestors have gathered in the area , with several concealing their faces with masks or balaclavas and chanting : no justice , no peace '' .
paul 's report continues : a dozen or so officers have lined up outside the police station , which is protected with a metal barrier .
with less than 40 minutes until the announcement of the grand jury decision , tensions are high .
everyone i 've spoken to said they expect the panel not to indict darren wilson .
in the last ten minutes the crowd had swelled and has now fully taken over the road .
one man in an anonymous mask has stood on a car roof .
there was some pushing and shoving - which quickly fizzled - after rumours there was someone from the kkk here .
the atmosphere is tense as people wait for the ruling .

here 's a video paul has just filed of police reinforcements arriving : police reinforcements arriving at ferguson police department here are some of paul 's images from the scene : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) surreal to see this outside # ferguson police department , scene of recent protests - and where crowds gathering now paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) this man says he 's an ex-cop , captain ray lewis .
`` i wanted to bring a white police captain 's face here . ''
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) re previous tweet .
no way of corroborating whether he is an ex-cop .
apparently he was active during occupy wall st days .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) crowd outside ferguson police dept now looks than 300 strong .
atmosphere is tense .
chants of `` we 've got to fight back '' .
law enforcement officers prepare for a night in the streets .
via st. louis post-dispatch staff photographer david carson : david carson ( @ pdpj ) command center busy w/ preparations for announcement of grand jury decision # ferguson # mikebrown

here is a video from missouri governor jay nixon 's press conference from a little earlier in the evening : ahead of the announcement of a missouri grand jury 's decision on whether to indict a white police officer in the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager in ferguson , leaders held a news conference to call for calm .

the guardian 's jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) is at the courtroom in clayton where bob mcculloch will announce the grand jury 's decision : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) here is the tiny courtroom where bob mcculloch will announce the ferguson grand jury decision .
44 seats

whatever happens next - the safety of the public is the top priority of police , according to st louis county police , who 've just issued a news release to that effect , on behalf of chief jon belmar .

the statement also mentions protecting property : st. louis county chief of police jon belmar wants the entire st. louis community to know that the safety of our citizens is the primary concern for the st. louis county police department .
as a police department , our primary responsibility is to protect both life and property for our citizens , and we are committed to doing just that .

st. louis metropolitan chief of police sam dotson , missouri state highway patrol captain ron johnson , and i , have prepared extensively as a unified command , for the release of the grand jury decision .

our commanders have been meeting with local community officials and protest leaders to help ensure preservation of life , property , and that all citizens ' enjoy the freedom to express their constitutional rights . ''

before the grand jury decision is announced in the next hour , here 's a summary of tonight 's events so far : the grand jury 's decision on whether to charge officer darren wilson over the death of unarmed 18 year-old michael brown will be delivered at 8pm ct. protestors have begun to assemble at points in the city .
local news report suggest around 150 have gathered outside the ferguson police department .
missouri officials , including governor jay nixon and st louis mayor francis slay , have called for calm ahead of the decision and warned protestors police will act against any acts of violence .
if officer wilson is not indicted , st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch 's office plans to release grand jury documents without seeking a judge 's approval , according to reports .
in an interview with the guardian , the michael brown 's uncle leslie mcspadden has called on protestors to be patient and sit back and wait '' .
he said that brown 's family are hopeful that wilson will be charged .
the protest outside the ferguson police department on south florissant rd ( map ) is growing .

protesters have blocked - momentarily at least - an intersection north of the station at hereford ave ( aka chambers rd aka airport ) , according to people at the scene ( more here ) : ferguson police department protest , 24 november 2014 .
activists say 75 rallies are planned across the united states tonight in solidarity with protesters in ferguson .
the national rallies were planned for the day of the announcement of the ferguson grand jury 's decision , whatever it may be .
a list of rally locations is here .
marissa j. lang ( @ marissa jae ) there are 75 actions planned re : tonight 's # ferguson decision .
i 'll be covering the one in # sacramento .
# darrenwilson
the guardian 's adam gabbatt ( @ adamgabbatt ) has spoken with leslie mcspadden , an uncle of michael brown .
mcspadden called for calm ahead of the grand jury 's decision being announced at 8pm .
adam writes : a lot of you all did n't get to actually meet mike mike , '' mcspadden told the guardian .
mike mike would n't want violence . ''
mcspadden said his nephew would want protesters to be patient and sit back and wait '' .
mcspadden , who is the younger brother of michael brown 's mum , said he and the family expect darren wilson to be indicted when the grand jury 's verdict is announced at 8pm tonight .
leslie mcspadden , an uncle of michael brown .
gabbatt while mcspadden is hopeful that wilson is charged and hopes protesters behave , he is concerned about what the opposite verdict could mean for ferguson .
the city as we know it as gon na be alight .
destruction is in the future . ''
he said his nephew 's death was the one that counted '' and made people take notice .
the one that made people say : 'oh hell , damn , this is going on . ' ''
leslie mcspadden , an uncle of michael brown .
a number of protesters have gathered outside the ferguson police department on south florissant rd .
protesters , dressed warmly as temperatures head south past 40 degrees fahrenheit , hold signs reading justice for mike brown . ''
a small number of officers - not in riot gear - stand across the street , outside the police building .

zak cheney-rice ( @ zakcheneyrice ) still waiting for 8pm announcement but good number of ppl already assembled across from # ferguson pd there are some emergency vehicles at the scene on canfield drive where brown was killed , meanwhile , but no reports of violence .
this vine via tim pool ( @ timcast ) : tim pool ( @ timcast ) police , emt , and fire at memorial site in # ferguson but seems unrelated .

one correspondent at the nixon news conference , who identified as a member of the alternative press , asked what officials thought of calls from revolutionaries that if darren wilson is not indicted for murder , the country be brought to a halt through energetic civil disobedience by millions of people ? ''
the answer : we do n't know what the grand jury has decided .
the guardian 's paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) captured video of the question : a questioner at the nixon news conference .
and here are the full opening remarks from mayor slay : we face one of those times today .
what happened to mike brown has deeply divided us .
whatever is announced this evening , some people are going to be angry and frustrated .
and some people are going to be angry and frustrated about that .
my message to the protesters : we will protect your right to peaceably assemble and speak your mind .
like last night , we will give you leeway to occupy public safety , and we will listen to your grievances .
but turning violent or damaging property will not be tolerated .
to the people who disagree with the protesters , the actions we 're taking are designed to protect you , to protect your homes , your families , your businesses and your neighborhoods .
that is our paramount concern .
over the next few days we expect to see st louisans loudly and passionately expressing their views .
we expect to see police officers protecting their rights and keeping everyone safe .
but after that it will be time to heal .
to close the racial divide .
and to make st louis a better place for everyone , regardless of race or color .
we all may experience inconvenience in the coming days .
depending on the circumstances , we may allow demonstrators to slow down traffic .
but we will not allow them to hurt anyone or damage anyone 's property .
the world will be watching us .
they 're going to walk how we end our disagreements in the coming days st louis finds itself with the opportunity to show a nation [ how to be ] more fair and more just to everyone .
there 's an ongoing battle among tv producers to book the first on-camera interview with officer darren wilson ( presumably contingent on his not being otherwise occupied ) .
politico has the nitty-gritty .
they say abc news ' george stephanopoulos is in the lead .
anderson cooper ( @ andersoncooper ) for the record , i met briefly with darren wilson a few days ago to see if he wanted to do an interview with me .
that 's standard procedure anderson cooper ( @ andersoncooper ) darren wilson chose not to do an interview with me .
i continue to hope to interview anyone with information about this tragedy .
here are governor nixon 's opening remarks in full : good evening .
i 'm pleased to be joined by st louis mayor francis slay , st. louis county executive charlie dooley and public safety director dan isom .
later this evening , the st louis county prosecutor will announce the grand jury 's decision .
while none of us knows what that will be , our shared hope and expectation is that regardless of that decision , people on all sides show tolerance , mutual respect and restraint .
earlier today , i visited with some folks in ferguson , and it 's understandable that , like the rest of us , they are on edge waiting for the decision .
but they are doing their best to go on with their daily lives , conduct their business and support one another and their community .
i also spoke with a number of faith leaders this afternoon who offered their prayers for peace and safety .
together we are all focused on making sure the necessary resources are at hand to protect lives , to protect property and to protect free speech .
he says churches will be open to provide food , shelter and medical care .
mental health professionals will be available for counseling .
law enforcement officials continue to maintain open lines of communication with protest leaders to improve the interactions between police and demonstrators and prevent violence .
state and local law enforcement are continuing to work hand-in-hand to make sure the best and most experienced officers are on the streets .

the men and women of the national guard will also be in the area to provide security at critical facilities , like firehouses , police stations and utility substations , and offer logistical and transportation support as needed .
this will help free up law enforcement officers to do their jobs effectively .
in closing , i 'd like to reiterate my call for peace , respect and restraint , and thank everyone out there who 's working hard to make sure communities throughout the region are safe and secure .
and with that governor nixon 's short conference is drawn to a close .
the key points to come from that i 've listed below .
we 'll bring you a fuller transcript in a short while : nixon is not aware of what the grand jury 's decision is .
he emphasised that whilst he respects protestors right to protest any violence will not be tolerated by police .
he declined to rule out police interception of protestors ' communications , but did not go into operational detail .

nixon said the national guard have been called up to provide security at critical facilities , like firehouses , police stations and utility substations , and offer logistical and transportation support as needed . ''
mayor slay also called for calm and said the police would respect the rights of protestors to peacefully protest .
after the protests , he said , it will be time for ferguson to heal .

slay added that police have been instructed to be flexible over acts of peaceful civil disobedience , including acts that slow down traffic , but echoed nixon 's message that acts of violence would not be tolerated by police .
governor nixon is asked whether police plan to intercept protestors ' communications .

nixon say he wo n't go into operational detail but : the bottom line is we are respecting people 's rights to communicate , however , on the other side if people are violent resources will be used to manage the issue . ''
st louis mayor francis slay takes to the lectern .
he acknowledges that the death of michael brown has deeply divided us '' and says that whatever is announced today some people are going to be angry and frustrated '' .
he assures protestors police will preserve the right to protest peacefully '' but adds that turning violent will not be tolerated '' .
he says over the next few days he expects to see residents passionately expressing their views '' but after that it will be time to heal '' .
missouri governor jay nixon has just begun addressing the press .
he starts by stating he does not know what the grand jury 's decision is .
regardless of the decision he calls for residents to show tolerance , mutual respect and restraint '' throughout the evening .
he says he has met with local residents earlier who are on edge waiting for the decision '' and with local faith leaders who have prayed for peace and safety '' .

guardian reporter paul lewis is at the venue for missouri governor jay nixon 's press conference , which is due to start in the next few minutes : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) gov jay nixon will call for calm from this lectern 15 mins , 5.30pm .
grand jury decision will be at 8pm .
# ferguson

my colleague jon swaine has just posted this analysis piece on the key questions that could be answered in grand jury documents that look set to be released by the st louis county prosecutor if wilson is not charged .
you can read the full article here , but below is a brief summary of the four questions and issues at stake : 1 .
did wilson know that brown was a robbery suspect ?

issue : wilson reportedly confirmed to the grand jury during his four-hour testimony that he first stopped brown and brown 's friend , dorian johnson , on 9 august because they were jaywalking down canfield drive .

but he apparently said that as the pair walked away , he realised that brown matched a description for a suspect in a so-called strong-arm '' robbery at a nearby grocery store minutes earlier , that had been broadcast over police radio .
it was this , wilson reportedly claims , that led him to pull his suv up to brown , where a struggle ensued .
how badly injured was wilson ?
issue : police and supporters of wilson have said that the officer suffered significant injuries to his face during the struggle with brown at the officer 's suv .
how far was brown from wilson 's suv when he was shot ?
issue : the day after brown was killed , police gave a fairly clear description of where he died in relation to wilson 's suv , where the pair engaged in a struggle .

the entire scene , from approximately the car door to the shooting , is about 35 feet , '' chief belmar of st louis county said at a 10 august press conference , repeating this five minutes later for emphasis .
did witnesses dispute that michael brown had his hands up ?

issue : a series of witnesses , beginning with brown 's friend dorian johnson , told media in the weeks after the shooting that when brown stopped fleeing and turned to face wilson , he raised his arms in surrender .
their statements convinced demonstrators that brown was murdered , and led to the creation of hands up - do n't shoot ! ''
as the unofficial slogan of the movement protesting over his death .
a small protest was taking shape earlier at the scene of michael brown 's killing on canfield drive in ferguson .
micah grimes ( @ micahgrimes ) small crowd developing at scene of michael brown 's death in # ferguson .
a man stands in street , loudly protesting .

documents.title: grand jury decision to be announced at 8pm cst
text: the office of bob mcculloch , the prosecuting attorney for st louis county , has confirmed that the grand jury verdict will be announced at a press conference in the clayton justice centre at 8pm local time .
this confirms reports from earlier .

if police officer darren wilson is not indicted in the killing of michael brown , st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch 's office plans to release grand jury documents without seeking a judge 's approval , according to a lawyer in mcculloch 's office quoted by the st louis post-dispatch .

if it 's an open record , with all due respect [ to the court ] , we did n't need permission '' to release the documents , the lawyer , john hessel , was quoted as saying : the failure to indict wilson would render the case inactive , which would obligate mcculloch to release records inquiring into a suspected crime '' open , subject to certain redactions , '' hessel wrote in a memorandum in support of the original motion .

greg jonsson ( @ jonssonville ) st. louis county prosecutor will release records if no indictment , even without judge 's approval : # ferguson the post-dispatch explains that the records to be released would not include jurors ' names but would include the testimony of witnesses : mcculloch asked a court reporter to transcribe grand jury testimony for the use of the prosecuting attorney '' and the filing says that the transcription is now a record of the prosecuting attorney .
mcculloch would not release autopsy photographs , the names of the grand jurors , minutes or notes of any grand juror , nor any documents of the grand jury , '' the memo says .
some observers have captured images of the particularly high levels of security around the clayton justice centre : antonio french ( @ antoniofrench ) well , at least they have n't built a moat yet .
justin baragona ( @ justinbaragona ) police using bomb sniffing dogs near courthouse ahead of grand jury announcement # ferguson
video : white house urges calm ahead of ferguson jury decision white house spokesman josh earnest says the parents of michael brown have asked for calm and so does the president .
in addition to cancelling after-school activities monday , the ferguson-florissant school district has cancelled classes for tuesday , in consideration of the safety of all students and staff '' .

a statement posted to the district 's web site reads : due to the anticipated increase in traffic and possible demonstrations in our area as a result of the pending grand jury announcement this evening , and in consideration of the safety of all students and staff , the ferguson-florissant school district will be closed on tuesday , nov. 25 .
all after-school and evening activities will also be canceled .
information about our church partner sites serving meals on tuesday and other relevant information for families will be posted on the district website , facebook and twitter pages .
ferguson-florissant has more than 11,000 children enrolled from preschool through 12th grade .
the district has 17 elementary schools , three middle schools , three high schools , and one alternative school , the district web site says .
a war memorial outside the st louis county police department has been covered up : lucas geisler ( @ lucasabc17 ) @ jonswaine @ twitterid ww1 memorial outside stl co. pd .
( attached photo taken at 2 pm )
missouri governor jay nixon is holding a conference call with st. louis-area clergy in advance of the grand jury announcement , ap reports : the rev .
ronald bobo sr. says he and other clergy have been invited to participate in a conference call with the governor . ''
my colleague jon swaine in ferguson reports official sources in st louis have said the grand jury 's decision will be announced at 8pm cst .

meanwhile local media in st louis are reporting a number of school districts in the area are calling off after school activities in antipation of protests in the area : emily rau ( @ emilyrau ) add clayton schools to that list .
also confluence charter schools .
# kmov emily rau ( @ emilyrau ) add ferguson-florissant , affton and lindbergh to list of districts canceling after school activities .
# kmov
while much of the focus of today 's reporting will be on expected in unrest in ferguson , some residents in the city are trying to get on with their lives away from the protests .
my colleague paul lewis has sent this photo of young ferguson resident keylin hodges who celebrated his birthday at a diner in the city as news of the impending grand jury decision broke .
hodges ' mom , pinky , told our reporter she had been shielding she had shielded keylin from the news .
pray it stays peaceful , '' she said .

meanwhile , there are reports that brown 's family have asked protestors to observe a 4 and a half minute silence before beginning action to mark the roughly four and a half hours brown was left in the street after he was shot .
skip lacombe ( @ skiplacombe ) brown family asking for 4.5 minutes of silence before protests ; for to the 4.5 hours brown 's body lay in the street # ferguson
the guardian 's adam gabbatt and paul lewis tried to ask missouri governor jay nixon questions during his stop at a burger joint just over an hour ago .
but the governor got away .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) here 's @ twitterid fleeing qs from our @ twitterid & @ twitterid in ferguson burger bar earlier - pic by adam

a correspondent with local channel 4 kmov reports many businesses are boarded up in clayton and tweets a of a locked us postal service mail collection box : alissa reitmeier ( @ alissareitmeier ) many # clayton businesses have boarded up .
@ twitterid suspended blue mailboxes there .
# grandjury announcement tonight .

documents.title: governor to speak at 5.30pm local time
text: missouri governor jay nixon is scheduled to speak , the guardian 's jon swaine reports : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) gov nixon to speak at the university of missouri in st louis at 5.30 cst that 's 6.30pm et .
update : a media advisory says nixon will be joined by department of public safety director dan isom , st. louis county executive charlie dooley and st. louis mayor francis slay .
they will be calling for peace and discussing preparations to protect the public and free speech , in anticipation of the announcement of the grand jury decision , '' the advisory says .

police set up a command post over the weekend in a shopping mall just outside ferguson , the guardian 's jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) reported : as county government buildings were barricaded in clayton , police began taking over parts of a shopping mall in jennings , just outside ferguson , where they ran a command centre during nights of clashes between officers and protesters that followed the death of michael brown on 9 august .
another organization with an outsized presence in ferguson right now : the media .
sen. frank niceley ( @ senfrankniceley ) shot of media presence in # clayton # ferguson
business in ferguson and the surrounding area are boarding up windows in advance of the announcement of the grand jury decision .
lisa brown ( @ lisabrownstl ) clayton jeweler the diamond shop near where grand jury in # ferguson decision will be announced boarding up now
what charges might officer darren wilson face ?
the 12-person grand jury was considering a range of charges against wilson , 28 , including manslaughter and murder .
or he may avoid charges altogether .
evidence relating to the shooting of michael brown was presented to grand jurors at weekly sessions for more than three months .

documents.title: michael brown killing : grand jury decision to be announced 'later today '
text: the grand jury 's decision whether to charge wilson will be announced later today '' , the st louis county prosecutor 's office has confirmed .

the guardians ' jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) reports : ed magee , a spokesman for st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch , said in a statement : the grand jury hearing the michael brown/darren wilson investigation has reached a decision and it will be announced later today . ''
the associated press has reported that the brown family lawyer , benjamin crump , says the grand jury 's decision will be announced later this evening .
some news sources are saying that announcement will come at 5pm et .
this timing is , however , unconfirmed .
abc7 news ( @ abc7newsbayarea ) # breaking : # ferguson grand jury completes deliberations , announcement on decision expected today at 5 p.m .

reports are now coming in from cnn that michael brown 's family have been notified that the grand jury has come to a decision , but have not been told what decision that decision is : noah gray ( @ noahgraycnn ) urgent - brown family attorney tells cnn 's @ twitterid that the family has been notified a decision has been reached .
# ferguson noah gray ( @ noahgraycnn ) the grand jury looking into the shooting of michael brown has been released and sent home , local & federal law enforcement sources tell cnn .
according to reporters on the ground , missouri governor jay nixon has arrived in ferguson as well : alan blinder ( @ alanblinder ) gov .
jay nixon of missouri has arrived in # ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) governor jay nixon just stopped at a diner in # ferguson near to where michael brown was shot .
declined to say when his press conference is .
you can follow guardian reporters jon swaine , adam gabbatt , and paul lewis who will be reporting from ferguson all throughout the day .

my colleague jon swaine is in ferguson and has filed this report with the latest on the expected decision : bob mcculloch , the prosecuting attorney for st louis county , is expected to hold a press conference later on monday .
it is unclear whether he will immediately announce whether officer darren wilson has been indicted for killing michael brown on 9 august .
governor jay nixon is also reportedly planning a public appearance .
a public filing showed that he was due to fly into st louis on his official plane later on monday afternoon .
hello and welcome .
a grand jury decision on whether to charge missouri police officer darron wilson for the murder or manslaughter of the black teenager michael brown is set to be announced in the coming hours .

the 12 member grand jury , consisting of nine white members and three black , began hearing evidence on 20 august - over three months ago - following the shooting of the unarmed 18 year-old on 9 august .
the decision has loomed for days and tensions in the city of ferguson have continued to build , with police and protestors clashing recently .
it is anticipated that large protests will commence once the grand jury returns its verdict , irrespective of their decision .
brown 's death has sparked waves of continued unrest and protest in ferguson , with missouri governor jay nixon using an executive order to declare a state of emergency last week .
nixon has called in both the national guard and state police reinforcements to deal with anticipated unrest .
the decision has been criticised by protestors as evidence of a further military-style crackdown on protests .
police have refused to rule out the use of rubber bullets , tear gas and armoured vehicles in response to protest organisers requested rules of engagement '' , submitted to police last week .
the new york times reported monday that officer wilson married in a low key ceremony in clayton last month .

bulletin.text: No charges filed against officer Darren Wilson.
Wilson shot dead unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown.
Missouri governor calls for 'peace, respect and restraint'
